channel.title: Doctors On Health Audio Newsletter
channel.itunes:author: Doctors of MedicineNet.com
channel.description: Medical and health audio commentary from the doctors of MedicineNet.com
channel.itunes:subtitle: Medical and health audio commentary from the doctors of MedicineNet.com
channel.itunes:summary: Medical and health audio commentary from the doctors of MedicineNet.com. Our doctors cover patient information on current health news related to medicine, viewer questions, doctors tips and suggestions, and the latest medical research. Listen in as our doctors help you better understand medicine.

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Head Lice Prevention
item.itunes:author: MedicineNet.com
item.description: There are number of ways in which a child can contract head lice most commonly perhaps contact with an already infested person. Personal contact can be very common during childrens's activities such as school, playing sports activities.
item.itunes:subtitle: Head Lice Prevention
item.itunes:summary: There are number of ways in which a child can contract head lice most commonly perhaps contact with an already infested person. Personal contact can be very common during childrens's activities such as school, playing sports activities.
item.itunes:keywords: head lice Head Lice HEAD LICE head lice treatment Head Lice Treatment podcast medical podcast head lice in children head lice prevention

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Diabetes and Exercise
item.itunes:author: MedicineNet.com
item.description: Diabetics need to check their blood sugar before and after exercising. Diabetics who do not check their blood sugar run the risk of hypoglycemia which can cause dizziness, as well as other complications. Just because you are a diabetic doesn't mean you can't exercise. But it is important to check with your doctor before beginning any exercise program, especially if you are over the age of 35 and run the risk of heart complications.
item.itunes:subtitle: Diabetes and Exercise
item.itunes:summary: Diabetics need to check their blood sugar before and after exercising. Diabetics who do not check their blood sugar run the risk of hypoglycemia as well as other complications.
item.itunes:keywords: diabetes Diabetes exercise diabetic diabetics diabetes and exercise podcast diabetes podcast insulin blood sugar hypoglycemia

item.title: MedicineNet.com - ADHD and Alcoholism
item.itunes:author: MedicineNet.com
item.description: If it is undiagnosed and untreated, ADHD can be associated with sometimes significant academic and social problems. The teen can try and self-medicate with alcohol. Parents and educators can work together to monitor the symptoms.
item.itunes:subtitle: ADHD and Alcoholism
item.itunes:summary: If it is undiagnosed and untreated, ADHD can be associated with sometimes significant academic and social problems. The teen can try and self-medicate with alcohol. Parents and educators can work together to monitor the symptoms.
item.itunes:keywords: adhd ADHD Adhd Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder attention deficit hyperactivity disorder add ADD attention deficit disorder Attention Deficit Disorder alcoholism Alcoholism ALCOHOLISM podcast

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Exercises for Graceful Aging
item.itunes:author: MedicineNet.com
item.description: The most important thing is that we remain active as we get older, with aerobic exercise, and also exercises like Tai Chi and yoga, things that improve balance. We want to be physically active in our daily life, and remain active in our heads so we don't feel dependent on other people. Resistance exercise is great for the elderly, as well as balance exercises. Walking activities are important because your heart gets stronger as you continue to practice. Aerobics can even decrease the onset of Alzheimer's so it's working in the brain as well.
item.itunes:subtitle: Exercises for Graceful Aging
item.itunes:summary: The most important thing is that we remain active as we get older, with aerobic exercise, and also exercises like Tai Chi and yoga, things that improve balance. We want to be physically active in our daily life, and remain active in our heads so we don't feel dependent on other people.
item.itunes:keywords: aging Aging exercise Exercise EXERCISE old age Old Age senior health elderly exercises for elderly senior activities podcast

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Avoiding Vacation Weight Gain
item.itunes:author: MedicineNet.com
item.description: Vacations should be an opportunity to re-energize, refresh, and relax -- not an excuse to take a break from health. When planning your vacation, opt for locations that will allow you to engage in physical activities you enjoy. Keep in mind that physical activity is the ticket to enjoying extra calories without weight gain.
item.itunes:subtitle: Avoiding Vacation Weight Gain
item.itunes:summary: Vacations should be an opportunity to re-energize, refresh, and relax -- not an excuse to take a break from health. When planning your vacation, opt for locations that will allow you to engage in physical activities you enjoy. Keep in mind that physical activity is the ticket to enjoying extra calories without weight gain.
item.itunes:keywords: weight gain Weight Gain Weight gain vacation Vacation vacation tips gaining weight

item.title: MedicineNet.com - The Role of Weightlifting in Weight Loss
item.itunes:author: Exercise Physiologist Rich Weil - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Exercise is the best way to keep the weight off after you have lost weight. Most of the weight gain from weightlifting is from fluid in the muscle, and water is heavy.You want to gain muscle because when you lose weight, twenty five percent of your weight loss is from muscle. The fastest way to lose weight is to cut your calorie intake.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Role of Weightlifting in Weight Loss
item.itunes:summary: Exercise is the best way to keep the weight off after you have lost weight. Most of the weight gain from weightlifting is from fluid in the muscle, and water is heavy.You want to gain muscle because when you lose weight, twenty five percent of your weight loss is from muscle. The fastest way to lose weight is to cut your calorie intake.

item.title: MedicineNet.com - The Prevalance of Autism Today
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Autism spectrum disorders are the second most common serious developmental disability in the US, following mental retardation and intellectual impairment. CDC reports state that among 8-year-olds, 1 in 150 have autism spectrum disorder. That means 1.5 million Americans have autism spectrum disorder
item.itunes:subtitle: The Prevalence of Autism
item.itunes:summary: Autism spectrum disorders are the second most common serious developmental disability in the US, following mental retardation and intellectual impairment. CDC reports state that among 8-year-olds, 1 in 150 have autism spectrum disorder. That means 1.5 million Americans have autism spectrum disorder

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Kidney Stones Symptoms and Prevention
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: One in 20 people will develop a kidney stone throughout their life. Dehydration can result in decrease of urine volume, which can also lead to kidney stones. Those who have had kidney stones once are more likely to have them again. Drinking plenty of water is the best preventative measure against kidney stone formation.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kidney Stones- Symptoms and Prevention
item.itunes:summary: One in 20 people will develop a kidney stone throughout their life. Dehydration can result in decrease of urine volume, which can also lead to kidney stones. Those who have had kidney stones once are more likely to have them again. Drinking plenty of water is the best preventative measure against kidney stone formation.
item.itunes:keywords: kidney stones kidney stone symptoms of kidney stones kidney stone symptoms kidney stones in women passing kidney stones kidney stones podcast treatment for kidney stones kidney stones treatment kidney stone treatment kidney stones symptoms kidney stone cause cause of kidney stone podcast

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Prostate Cancer- The Importance of a PSA Test
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: An elevated PSA level in a patient with a history of cancer doesn't necessarily mean the cancer has recurred. There are no specific normal or abnormal PSA levels, but the higher the PSA level, the more likely cancer is present. When PSA levels continue to rise over time, other tests may be ordered.
item.itunes:subtitle: Prostate Cancer- The Importance of a PSA Test
item.itunes:summary: An elevated PSA level in a patient with a history of cancer doesn't necessarily mean the cancer has recurred. There are no specific normal or abnormal PSA levels, but the higher the PSA level, the more likely cancer is present. When PSA levels continue to rise over time, other tests may be ordered.
item.itunes:keywords: prostate cancer prostate cancer symptoms prostate cancer treatment prostate cancer treatments early symptoms prostate cancer symptoms of prostate cancer advanced prostate cancer psa test treatment ofr prostate cancer signs of prostate cancer prostate cancer podcast

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Osteoporosis- Symptoms, Risk Factors and Prevention
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Osteoporosis features loss of the normal density of bone and fragile bone. It can operate silently for decades, because osteoporosis doesn't cause symptoms unless bone fractures. In the U.S, more than 10 million people have osteoporosis and almost 34 million more have low bone density.
item.itunes:subtitle: Osteoporosis- Symptoms, Risk Factors and Prevention
item.itunes:summary: Osteoporosis features loss of the normal density of bone and fragile bone. It can operate silently for decades, because osteoporosis doesn't cause symptoms unless bone fractures. In the U.S, more than 10 million people have osteoporosis and almost 34 million more have low bone density.
item.itunes:keywords: osteoporosis osteoporosis treatment cuases of osteoporosis what is osteporosis osteoporosis diet osteoporosis prevention symptoms of osteoporosis new treatments for osteoporosis

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Gastric Bypass Surgery- Risks and Controversy
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Gastric bypass surgery is a risky weight loss surgery and is only done on patients who are significantly obese. Patients who undergo gastric bypass surgery require lifelong changes in eating habits. Risks of gastric bypass surgery include infection, developing blood clots, leaking of the stomach contents, and stretching of the pouch.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gastric Bypass Surgery- Risks and Controversy
item.itunes:summary: Patients who undergo gastric bypass surgery require lifelong changes in eating habits. Risks of gastric bypass surgery include infection, developing blood clots, leaking of the stomach contents, and stretching of the pouch.
item.itunes:keywords: gastric bypass surgery mini gastric bypass surgery bastric bypass diet after gastric bypass surgery research gastric bypass surgery gastric bypass surgery risk gastric bypass surgery podcast gastric bypass surgery for kids

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Chronic Fatigue Syndrome- Symptoms and Struggle
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Symptoms of chronic fatigue syndrome include extreme fatigue and weakness, headaches, tender lymph nodes, and muscle and joint aches. Although the cause of chronic fatigue syndrome is still unknown, doctors think it might be derived from anemia, hypoglycemia, or an environmental allergy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome- Symptoms and Struggle
item.itunes:summary: Symptoms of chronic fatigue syndrome include extreme fatigue and weakness, headaches, tender lymph nodes, and muscle and joint aches. Although the cause of chronic fatigue syndrome is still unknown, doctors think it might be derived from anemia, hypoglycemia or an environmental allergy.
item.itunes:keywords: chronic fatigue syndrome Chronic Fatigue Syndrome cause of chronic fatigue syndrome

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Testicular Cancer, Symptoms and Detection
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Symptoms of testicular cancer include a painless lump or swelling in the testicle and acute pain in the scrotum. Other symptoms of testicular cancer can be an ache in the lower back as well as in the groin and a collection of fluid in the scrotum as well. Early diagnosis of testicular cancer is critical, which is why it's important for men to be performing a testicular self exam every month to screen for testicular cancer.
item.itunes:subtitle: Testicular Cancer, Symptoms and Detection
item.itunes:summary: Symptoms of testicular cancer include a painless lump or swelling in the testicle and acute pain in the scrotum. Other symptoms of testicular cancer can be an ache in the lower back as well as in the groin and a collection of fluid in the scrotum as well. Early diagnosis of testicular cancer is critical, which is why it's important for men to be performing a testicular self exam every month to screen for testicular cancer.
item.itunes:keywords: testicular cancer testicular cancer symptom Testicular Cancer Symptoms testicular cancer symptoms Signs of Testicular Cancer Testicular Cancer symptoms of testicular cancer signs of testicular cancer Testicular cancer

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Surviving A Heat Wave-Without Air Conditioning
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: In summer, heat waves can strike areas of the country where cooler climates are the norm. In these areas, many homes do not have air conditioning, and surviving in the extreme temperatures becomes a challenge for everyone. There are steps you can take to keep cool during a heat wave even if you don't have air conditioning.
item.itunes:subtitle: Surviving A Heat Wave
item.itunes:summary: In summer, heat waves can strike areas of the country where cooler climates are the norm. In these areas, many homes do not have air conditioning, and surviving in the extreme temperatures becomes a challenge for everyone.
item.itunes:keywords: weather local weather national weather heat maimi heat temperature air conditioning dehydration heat stroke hyperthermia

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Jellyfish Stings FAQs
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Jellyfish stings are an all-too-common health hazard for beach vacationers. While most jelly fish stings are harmless (with a few exceptions), they can be extremely painful. The stinging sensation results when stingers at the ends of the tentacles of jellyfish and other aquatic animals come into contact with human skin, usually while wading or swimming in the ocean.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jellyfish Stings FAQs
item.itunes:summary: Jellyfish stings are an all-too-common health hazard for beach vacationers. While most jelly fish stings are harmless (with a few exceptions), they can be extremely painful.
item.itunes:keywords: jellyfish box jellyfish fire coral fish tentacle ocean sea sting beach

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Antibiotics 101
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: It's very important to remember to take all the medication your doctor has prescribed and for the length of time. Antibiotics tend to work fairly rapidly so, many people feel better after they take a few doses or a few days worth of antibioitics and then they stop taking the remainder of the prescription. You should never stop taking your medication before the recommended length of time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Antibiotics 101
item.itunes:summary: It's very important to remember to take all the medication your doctor has prescribed and for the length of time. You should never stop taking your medication before the recommended length of time.
item.itunes:keywords: antibiotics antibiotic bacteria penicillin prescription drugs nausea diarrhea allergic reactions

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Dangers of Spider Bites
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: The majority of spiders found in the U.S. are harmless with two exceptions, the black widow spider and the brown recluse spider. Both of these spiders are considered dangerous to humans. Black widows and brown recluse spiders are more common in the southern states of the U.S. and prefer warm, dry climates and undisturbed areas to hide in, such as basements, closets, and attics.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dangers of Spider Bites
item.itunes:summary: The majority of spiders found in the U.S. are harmless with two exceptions, the black widow spider and the brown recluse spider. Both of these spiders are considered dangerous to humans.
item.itunes:keywords: brown recluse spider spiders spider bites spider black widow spider bite insects

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Battling Bulimia
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: American Idol runner-up recently disclosed her battle with bulimia. The risk of developing bulimia may come from: family history, substance abuse, cultural and social differences, etc. Medical complications may include: erosion of tooth enamel, ulcers, intestinal complications, and more. There is no known way to prevent bulimia but it helps to know the signs.
item.itunes:subtitle: Battling Bulimia
item.itunes:summary: American Idol runner-up recently disclosed her battle with bulimia. The risk of developing bulimia may come from: family history, substance abuse, cultural and social differences, etc. Along with these follow many medical complications.
item.itunes:keywords: bulimia anorexia eating disorder anorexia nervosa mental health depression body image body binging purging

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Cosmetic Surgery Checklist: Buyer Beware
item.itunes:author: Dr. Melissa Stoppler - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Over 10.2 million cosmetic plastic surgery procedures were performed in the U.S. in 2005, according to the American Society of Plastic Surgeons. If you're considering a cosmetic procedure, listen to Dr. Melissa Stoppler discuss questions you should be asking to help you choose the right doctor.
item.itunes:subtitle: Cosmetic Surgery Checklist: Buyer Beware
item.itunes:summary: Over 10.2 million cosmetic plastic surgery procedures were performed in the U.S. in 2005, according to the American Society of Plastic Surgeons. If you're considering a cosmetic procedure, listen to Dr. Melissa Stoppler discuss questions you should ask to help you choose the right doctor.
item.itunes:keywords: cosmetic surgery plastic surgery liposuction botox breast surgery cosmetic procedures

item.title: MedicineNet.com - HIV / AIDS Conference (CROI) Intro February 05, 2006
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. This has been traditionally now one of the main HIV research meetings of the year. There are 3800 researchers from around the world who have converged on Denver to present new information on both clinical and laboratory based research as well as behavioral research related to HIV and AIDS. Numerous important presentations from many investigators around the world including some important opening keynote presentations on the evening of February 5th
item.itunes:subtitle: Intro - February 5, 2006 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights reported by Dr. Eric Daar in Denver, Colorado
item.itunes:summary: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. This has been traditionally now one of the main HIV research meetings of the year. There are 3800 researchers from around the world who have converged on Denver to present new information on both clinical and laboratory based research as well as behavioral research related to HIV and AIDS. Numerous important presentations from many investigators around the world including some important opening keynote presentations on the evening of February 5th.
item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections Denver Colorado HIV transmission STIs

item.title: MedicineNet.com - 1st Day HIV / AIDS Conference (CROI) February 06, 2006
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. This meeting opened with a Plenary session and keynote lecture on Sunday, February 5th. The keynote was presented by Dr. James Kern on 25 years of the HIV pandemic, where he described his experience at the CDC in the first reported cases of AIDS in 1981 in Los Angeles. He emphasized the many advances in the following years as well as the obstacles overcome and the obstacles that are left to be overcome both with prevention, the development of vaccine, and the potential hope for eradication
item.itunes:subtitle: 1st Day - February 6, 2006 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights reported by Dr. Eric Daar in Denver, Colorado
item.itunes:summary: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. This meeting opened with a Plenary session and keynote lecture on Sunday, February 5th. The keynote was presented by Dr. James Kern on 25 years of the HIV pandemic, where he described his experience at the CDC in the first reported cases of AIDS in 1981 in Los Angeles. He emphasized the many advances in the following years as well as the obstacles overcome and the obstacles that are left to be overcome both with prevention, the development of vaccine, and the potential hope for eradication
item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections Denver Colorado HIV transmission STIs

item.title: MedicineNet.com - 2nd Day HIV / AIDS Conference (CROI) February 07, 2006
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. Update on meeting on second full day (February 7th). There were actually a series of world presentations all dealing with the related topic of treatment interruptions. Recently, a great deal of attention came to this area with the announcement of the data safety monitoring board closing one of these very important studies that was presented as a late breaker. The study was called SMART. It was a study through the CPCRA and the strategy was to determine whether you could take individuals with greater than 350 T cells and randomly assign them to either continue on their current therapy or interrupt their treatment with the plan of them restarting therapy if their CD4 count should drop to less than 250.
item.itunes:subtitle: 2nd Day - February 7, 2006 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights reported by Dr. Eric Daar in Denver, Colorado
item.itunes:summary: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. Update on meeting on second full day (February 7th). There were actually a series of world presentations all dealing with the related topic of treatment interruptions. Recently, a great deal of attention came to this area with the announcement of the data safety monitoring board closing one of these very important studies that was presented as a late breaker. The study was called SMART. It was a study through the CPCRA and the strategy was to determine whether you could take individuals with greater than 350 T cells and randomly assign them to either continue on their current therapy or interrupt their treatment with the plan of them restarting therapy if their CD4 count should drop to less than 250.
item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections Denver Colorado HIV transmission STIs

item.title: MedicineNet.com - 3rd Day HIV / AIDS Conference (CROI) February 08, 2006
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar - MedicineNet.com
item.description: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. Last day of conference (February 8th). It has been an extremely exciting day with some very important presentations in the area of complications of antiretroviral therapy and new treatments. The first presentation was from the CDC describing the experience in Uganda in over a thousand individuals started on antiretroviral therapy for the first time. There has been a major rollout of therapy in the developing world and this one with another report, were one of the largest to describe the tolerability of such therapy. This looked at over 1,000 individuals from 2003-2004 started on standard first line regimen in the developing world.
item.itunes:subtitle: 3rd Day - February 8, 2006 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights reported by Dr. Eric Daar in Denver, Colorado
item.itunes:summary: Hello this is Dr. Eric Daar calling from Denver, Colorado from the 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections or CROI 2006. Last day of conference (February 8th). It has been an extremely exciting day with some very important presentations in the area of complications of antiretroviral therapy and new treatments. The first presentation was from the CDC describing the experience in Uganda in over a thousand individuals started on antiretroviral therapy for the first time. There has been a major rollout of therapy in the developing world and this one with another report, were one of the largest to describe the tolerability of such therapy. This looked at over 1,000 individuals from 2003-2004 started on standard first line regimen in the developing world.
item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS 13th Conference on Retroviruses and Opportunistic Infections Denver Colorado HIV transmission STIs

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Prescription for Sleep
item.itunes:author: Dr. William Shiel - MedicineNet.com
item.description: The amount of sleep you need depends on many factors, including your age and whether you've had enough sleep in previous days. Experts say that if you feel drowsy during the day, even during boring activities, you haven't had enough sleep. Here's what to do.

item.title: MedicineNet.com - Connection Between Fibromyalgia and IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)?
item.itunes:author: Dr. William Shiel - MedicineNet.com
item.description: There does seem to be a higher incidence of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS or spastic colon) in patients who have fibromyalgia. Dr. Shiel discusses the relationship between these two diseases.

item.title: MedicineNet.com - HIV / AIDS Conference Update #3 July 27, 2005
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar of MedicineNet.com
item.description: Dr. Eric Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. July 27, 2005. Many of the most important presentations related to the treatment of HIV infection occurred today. Many of these studies challenged current treatment strategies and described new drugs that may provide options for the future. Topics such as new ways to use old drugs - "OK Study", single drug treatment with Lopinavir / Ritonavir caution, other important studies on Lopinavir / Ritonavir, undetectable viral loads, new regimens and side effect profiles, and the new drug Reverset are discussed.
item.itunes:subtitle: July 27, 2005 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights of the third and final day reported by Dr. Eric Daar who is in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Eric Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. July 27, 2005. Many of the most important presentations related to the treatment of HIV infection occurred today. Many of these studies challenged current treatment strategies and described new drugs that may provide options for the future. Topics such as new ways to use old drugs - "OK Study", single drug treatment with Lopinavir / Ritonavir caution, other important studies on Lopinavir / Ritonavir, undetectable viral loads, new regimens and side effect profiles, and the new drug Reverset are discussed.
item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS International AIDS Society Conference Rio de Janeiro ok study lopinavir ritonavir kaletra antiretroviral therapy viral loadsatazanavir reyataz zidovudine AZT 3TC epivir combivir efavirenz sustiva tenofovir viread emtricitabine ftc emtriva truvada reverset nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitor

item.title: MedicineNet.com - HIV / AIDS Conference Update #2 July 26, 2005
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar of MedicineNet.com
item.description: Dr. Eric Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. July 26, 2005. Hundreds of presentations were made on day 2 of this meeting with many being informative about the disease itself, select side-effects and treatment. Topics such as Genetic Factors and HIV and Antiretroviral Therapy and Drug Resistance are discussed.
item.itunes:subtitle: July 26, 2005 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights of the second day reported by Dr. Eric Daar who is in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Eric Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. July 26, 2005. item.itunes:keywords: HIV AIDS International AIDS Society Conference Rio de Janeiro genetic studies CD4 CCR5 Ziagen abacavir maraviroc SC 417690 videx didanosine tenofovir EF viread sustiva efavirenz aptivus tipranavir T-20 fuzeon enfuvirtide

item.title: MedicineNet.com - HIV / AIDS Conference Update #1 July 25, 2005
item.itunes:author: Dr. Eric Daar of MedicineNet.com
item.description: Dr. Eric Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. July 25, 2005 highlights include: Diversity of HIV strains from around the world - recombination, co-infection, and superinfection. Growing epidemics of HIV, particularly in Eastern Europe. Presentation by Dr. Blick on "Patient zero: The Connecticut source of the multi-drug resistant dual-topic, rapidly progressing HIV-1 strain found in New York City." Increasing transmission of drug resistant virus.
item.itunes:subtitle: July 25, 2005 HIV / AIDS Conference Hightlights reported by Dr. Eric Daar who is in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
item.itunes:summary: Dr. Daar reports from the 3rd International AIDS Society Conference on HIV Pathogenesis and Treatment in Rio de Janeiro Brazil. Presentation by Dr. Blick on "Patient zero: The Connecticut source of the multi-drug resistant dual-topic, rapidly progressing HIV-1 strain found in New York City." Increasing transmission of drug resistant virus.
